text.text: Unique palace converted into a hotel, we felt like royalty during our stay. We loved the horse carriage ride and the daily tea/snacks. The service was impeccable and faultless. The breakfast was great, good variety, lovely teas and beautiful views across the city. Dinner was great too, good portion sizes. The only negatives were location, as it was further from the city centre but we were not keen on leaving the hotel anyway, and the rooms are beautiful but slightly dated.

text.text:
🌟 Taj Falaknuma Palace – Hyderabad 🌟
A visit to Taj Falaknuma Palace is not just a trip, it’s a royal experience. Perched 2,000 feet above the city, this architectural marvel offers breathtaking views of Hyderabad and a glimpse into the grandeur of the Nizam era.

From the majestic marble staircases to the world’s longest dining table, every corner tells a story of luxury and history. The hospitality is impeccable, the food is exquisite, and the ambience makes you feel like royalty. 👑✨

✅ Perfect for: Heritage lovers, luxury dining, and once-in-a-lifetime experiences.
💯 A must-visit if you want to truly feel the soul of Hyderabad’s royal past.

text.text:
My husband surprised me with a stay at Taj Falaknuma Palace for my birthday, and I must say it was the best experience ever, literally! From the moment we arrived, every single detail was pure perfection.

The hospitality was world-class warm, thoughtful, and personalized in every way. Every staff member made us feel like royalty. The grandeur of the palace, the serene atmosphere, and the attention to detail created a truly magical experience.

The food? Absolutely next level! Every meal was a culinary masterpiece, bursting with flavor and served with elegance.

Every moment spent there was worth it. If you're looking to celebrate something special or just want to indulge in timeless luxury, Taj Falaknuma Palace is the place to be. I will cherish this memory forever!

text.text:
My experience at Falaknuma was absolutely flawless!! The entire staff treated us like royalty from check in to check out. The personalization, attentiveness, and in depth service was incredibly welcoming and unmatched for the price.

The room was immaculate and very cozy. The views all around the palace are breathtakingly beautiful. All of the food was delicious, fancy, and always came in plentiful portions. At the end of our stay the chef personally thanked us.

Suman did an outstanding job of serving us, he was always so polite, attentive, and helpful.

You absolutely HAVE to stay here if you’re visiting anywhere near Hyderabad. I can’t wait to come back!!

text.text: It is located at top of a hill, guests are often welcomed with a horse drawn carriage. Receiving a warm ceremonial greeting that evoke the Nizam era. It is designed in a unique scorpion shape, it has lavish interior and also has the world's largest dining table, seating 101 guests. There are 60 rooms and suites. Ranging from restored historical suites to luxurious royal rooms. They also provide a personal butler service. And the thought of dining where Nizams once entertained Kings and Queens heightens excitement. The first glimpse of the city from the palace terrace is very beautiful.

*"A Hidden Gem!"*

I recently dined at Peshawri and had an amazing experience! The food was incredible, with each dish more delicious than the last. The service was top-notch - our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly.

The ambiance was cozy and intimate, perfect for a night out with friends or a romantic evening. The prices were reasonable, especially considering the high quality of the food and service.

I highly recommend the Dal Bukhara - it's a must-try! Overall, I'd give this restaurant 5 stars and can't wait to come back.

Thank you Shubham and tushar for making our experience amazing

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Leela Palace, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was impeccable. The staff were warm, courteous, and attentive to every detail, ensuring a seamless and luxurious stay.

The property itself is stunning — an architectural masterpiece that blends traditional elegance with modern comfort. My room was beautifully appointed, with exquisite decor, top-notch amenities, and a view that was simply breathtaking.

Dining at The Leela was a culinary delight, with every meal crafted to perfection. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of fresh, delicious options, and the service was consistently excellent.

What truly stood out was the personalized attention and care provided by the team. It’s rare to find such a genuine commitment to guest satisfaction.

Thank you to everyone at The Leela Palace for making my stay so special. I look forward to returning and highly recommend this palace of hospitality to anyone seeking an extraordinary stay

text.text:
I recently stayed at The Leela, Hyderabad for two nights, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, the hospitality truly stood out. Since we were traveling with a toddler, the staff kindly escorted us straight to our room and completed the check-in formalities there, a thoughtful gesture that saved us time and made us feel instantly at ease.

The rooms were spacious, elegant, and very comfortable. The food throughout our stay was excellent, and we especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which offered a wide variety of delicious options. Room service was prompt and efficient.

What touched us most was the attention given to our child. The team had thoughtfully left a teddy bear, crayons, and a coloring book in the room for our 18-month-old, which made us feel genuinely welcomed and cared for.

A special thanks to Manisha and Amisha, who were incredibly kind and helpful throughout our stay. Their warmth and attentiveness truly elevated the entire experience.

I highly recommend The Leela, Hyderabad to anyone visiting the city, especially families with young children. It’s a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and heartfelt hospitality.

text.text:
The reason for choosing Leela was for the brand experience, and not getting that is very disappointing.

They had kept some in-room snacks, which were to be ordered separately. When I tried them, the quality was extremely poor — the manufacturing year was shown as 2024. Even after informing the team, I am not sure what action they intend to take.

On top of that, I still haven’t received my invoice, and the person assisting me seemed least bothered to even ask about it.

I really did not expect this kind of experience from such a reputed hotel.

I am also attaching a picture of the snacks I tried (just one piece) and returned immediately.

editorialSummary.text: Elegant rooms in an upscale hotel featuring 4 restaurants, an outdoor pool & a beauty salon.

text.text:
At first, I was a bit disappointed with my stay at Taj Krishna — my room didn’t have a bathtub, the view wasn’t as impressive as I’d hoped, and the work desk wasn’t very functional.

That said, the rest of the stay more than made up for it. The staff were warm and welcoming, the swimming pool was large and inviting, and the jacuzzi worked perfectly. Breakfast had a great spread and the service felt very well trained. The property seemed small at first glance but turned out to be more spacious than I expected.

One small downside was the bar area staff — they weren’t as polished or attentive as the rest of the team and felt a bit hit-or-miss, which was surprising in an otherwise well-run hotel.

Overall, a comfortable stay with classic Taj hospitality. Would recommend.

text.text:
From the moment I arrived, I was thoroughly impressed by the elegance and grandeur of the hotel building. The architecture seamlessly blends classic sophistication with modern luxury, creating a stunning first impression.
Inside, the aesthetic is equally captivating. Every space—from the lobby to the hallways and rooms—has been thoughtfully designed with an eye for detail. The interiors are warm, refined, and filled with character.
One of the standout features for me was the artwork throughout the hotel. The carefully curated paintings on the walls added a cultural and artistic depth that elevated the overall ambiance.
The staff were consistently professional, courteous, and genuinely welcoming. Whether it was the front door guards, front desk or housekeeping everyone went out of their way to ensure a comfortable and memorable stay. Their warmth and attentiveness truly set this hotel apart.

But unfortunately, the breakfast service on 03-08-2025 fell well below the mark.
Despite the elegant setting, the service was disorganized and inattentive. We waited an unreasonably long time just to be seated.
On buffet, some items were also cold and out of stock. Waiters were less in required number. We had to ask multiple times for puris and our order of dosa and uttapam from live counter-things that should be readily available at this level of service.  On sensing we are being irritated on level of service, incharge Mr. Sharath took interest in serving our order before things go awry.  I sensed they are ill prepared to serve breakfast in case of full occupancy of hotel.
For a hotel of this caliber, I expected efficiency, warmth, and attention to serve. Instead, it felt more like an over-burdened buffet than a luxury experience. Management should seriously reconsider staff training and supervision during breakfast hours, as this experience may leave lasting negative impression on an otherwise beautiful property.

Overall I If you’re looking for a place that combines architectural beauty, average breakfast service, and thoughtfully designed interiors, this hotel is a good choice.

One of those old properties in Hyderabad which is considered prestigious to stay. Sprawling property, good rooms, decent service levels, I have stayed here many times.

Sometimes it gets crowded with locals coming in for events and hence peace of residents is disturbed. The breakfast place is small and cannot accommodate in house guests, if the hotel is occupied. I couldn't get a place for both the days I stayed.

Overall, it is a good stay however rooms need attention and uplifting at the earliest.

I had an absolutely incredible stay at the Park Hyatt Hyderabad—a true five-star experience from start to finish.

From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff set the tone for the stay with their expeditious service. I was in a rush for a video work call, and they ensured my check-in was seamless and efficient, getting me to my room in under 10 minutes—something I truly appreciated. This was consistent for my entire team which was traveling with me.

Beyond the smooth check-in, the restaurants at the hotel exceeded all expectations. The culinary team frequently went above and beyond, even bringing out the chef personally to accommodate modifications and ensure I had exactly what I wanted. Breakfast was a standout—always served with a warm smile and a team that took hospitality to another level.

The rooms were immaculate, incredibly comfortable, and the hotel itself was spotless. Every detail—from the luxurious accommodations to the attentive service—was top-notch.

I was in a rush for a video work call, and they ensured my check-in was seamless and efficient, getting me to my room in under 10 minutes—something I truly appreciated. This was consistent for my entire team which was traveling with me.

Beyond the smooth check-in, the restaurants at the hotel exceeded all expectations. The culinary team frequently went above and beyond, even bringing out the chef personally to accommodate modifications and ensure I had exactly what I wanted. Breakfast was a standout—always served with a warm smile and a team that took hospitality to another level.

The rooms were immaculate, incredibly comfortable, and the hotel itself was spotless. Every detail—from the luxurious accommodations to the attentive service—was top-notch.

text.text:
Had a pleasant stay, took the valley view room but there is no valley and the staff acknowledged that.
Great equipment in the Gym and clean water in the pool. The food is really good and the chefs special dishes are great.

originalText.text:
Had a pleasant stay, took the valley view room but there is no valley and the staff acknowledged that.
Great equipment in the Gym and clean water in the pool. The food is really good and the chefs special dishes are great.

text.text:
Park Hyatt is one of the addresses for hospitality, still warm, still appreciative, but with that extra sprinkle of spice to tickle the funny bone. The staff's humor added a delightful touch to the experience.
If hospitality were an Olympic sport, this dream team would’ve taken home the gold, silver, and the buffet table.
Let’s start with Kareena, the receptionist, and Raj, the Duty Manager, who managed duties, guests, and occasional mood swings (mine, not hers) with the grace of a ballet dancer and the precision of a Swiss watch. Their ability to fix a problem before it even thought of becoming one made me feel like a truly valued guest.
At the front office, Abid and Abu were like Batman and Robin regarding guest relations. Need a room change? Done. Did you lose your key card? Found. Existential crisis? Well, they’d at least offer you tea with a reassuring smile.
Avinash, the F&B Manager, ensured I never left the dining area hungry—or skinny. Every meal felt like a Michelin-starred cheat day, and I didn’t complain once. My diet did, though. Loudly.
Then came Mr. Gerald, RM of Rika, a guide, who explained how to explore Hyatt points and membership, while Mukesh, our restaurant livewire.
Over at the fitness centre, Karthik tried valiantly to undo the damage caused by Avinash’s delicious sabotage. Whether it was treadmill therapy or gentle guilt-tripping, he had me moving—and miraculously smiling guide to his domain.
Rakesh Bhandari transformed breakfast into a daily celebration. I thought I was just grabbing toast and eggs, but no—he served joy with a side of “Try this too!” Every morning felt like brunch at grandma’s as if grandma were a gourmet chef with five-star charm.
And then, Krishna Rana. Not just a chef but a culinary wizard slash philosopher. Our conversations went from recipes to the meaning of life, all while he casually whipped up magic on a plate.
This band of pampering professionals didn’t just make my stay comfortable—they turned it into a sitcom, a food documentary, and a luxury retreat. Their dedication and humor made every moment a memorable experience.
If the home is where the heart is, then this place felt like a warm hug from a five-star hotel wrapped in laughter, good food, and people who genuinely care.

From the moment we arrived at hotel, we knew we were in for a special experience. The level of service exceeded all my expectations. We were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff Ms. Mamta, who made the check-in process smooth and stress-free. Not only did they accommodate my request for an early check-in, but they also graciously offered a late check-out, allowing me to enjoy my stay without feeling rushed.

To our delight, we were upgraded to a higher-category room, which truly enhanced our experience. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and spotlessly clean, with thoughtful amenities.

Throughout our stay, every staff member we encountered were courteous, professional, and eager to assist with anything we needed. It’s rare to find a team so dedicated to ensuring each guest feels valued and cared for.

Overall, our experience at ITC Kakatiya was exceptional. The combination of outstanding service, generous accommodations, and genuine hospitality made our visit truly memorable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking comfort, convenience, and an elevated level of care. We will definitely be returning on our next trip!

text.text: We visited Hyderabad from America and wanted to ensure our stay was comfortable while we spent time with family. As Marriott Bonvoy Reward members, we chose the Hyderabad Marriott, and it didn't disappoint. The concierge team at the Courtyard Marriott was extremely helpful in transferring us to the Marriott. The guestrooms were quite nice, and the food was excellent. Both the breakfast buffet and in-room dining were top-notch. The staff at the Okra restaurant—Madhusheee, Tamisha, Mohan, and Priyankar—took great care of us. The next time I visit Hyderabad, I will definitely return to the Marriott.

I spent a few days at the Hyderabad Marriott Hotel before my flight, and it was exactly what I needed.
While the hotel is not new, the service was truly exceptional—the staff went out of their way to help, and even prepared non-spicy meals for me daily. The massage was also excellent.

I came from a larger, flashier hotel but found this one much cozier and more relaxing. The view of the lake from the lobby brought a welcome sense of calm after time in the chaos of the city. I mostly stayed in the hotel to work, and it was a perfect setting.

If you’re looking to rest and be well taken care of, I highly recommend it.

editorialSummary.text: Glam hotel featuring lake views, a spa & an outdoor pool, plus 3 restaurants, 2 bars & a nightclub.

text.text:
I had high expectations from The Park Hyderabad, but the experience turned out to be disappointing. From the start, the vibe felt off – the lobby begins on the 3rd floor and lacked the welcoming feel I expected. The reception had all new faces who seemed inexperienced, which didn’t help.

The hotel’s design feels flawed. The swimming pool is placed right next to the dining area, which makes swimming uncomfortable and also raises concerns about diners accidentally dropping things into the pool. My room had a bathtub with no proper drainage, so water spilled into the room. The only good part was the cleaning staff on the 8th floor who kept cleaning up the mess – though it clearly seemed like a daily extra burden for them due to poor planning.

The passages were dimly lit, there was no proper gym, and the balcony had no view. While some of the 3rd-floor staff were decent, the bar staff mocked customer choices – something I’d never expect in a 5-star hotel. The overall vibe felt more like a casual hangout spot rather than a premium hospitality experience.

Not the luxury stay I had hoped for. Management really needs to address these issues.

text.text:
Thank You for a Wonderful Staycation at Hyatt Hotel!

I recently had the pleasure of spending a staycation at the Hyatt, and I must say, it was an incredible experience from start to finish! The hotel offered everything I was looking for in a perfect getaway, with outstanding service.

The breakfast spread was absolutely delicious, with a variety of options that catered to all tastes. From fresh pastries to hot dishes, every item was prepared to perfection, and it was the perfect way to start my day.

Every team member went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. They were friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with a smile, which made me feel right at home. It’s clear that the Hyatt values its guests and puts a great emphasis on hospitality.

Overall, I had an amazing time and will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends and family. Thank you, Hyatt, for delivering such a memorable and relaxing experience! I'll certainly be back for another stay soon.

Special thanks to Mr. Saurabh from restaurant manager and his team member named mr. Suraj & ms. Rakhi and housekeeping staff mr. Nitesh once again thank you for delivering best services.

text.text:
My stay at Le Meridien Hyderabad was delightful, and I left feeling refreshed and thoroughly impressed. From the moment I arrived, the hotel's welcoming ambiance was apparent.

The rooms are well appointed, spacious, and comfortable. The food was consistently excellent. The facilities were well-maintained. The staff were generally very attentive and eager to assist, always with a smile.

My only minor feedback would be that while the staff's friendliness was appreciated, some interactions, including extended chats and frequent requests for Google reviews, occasionally felt a little intrusive.

I hope the hotel considers a more streamlined approach to guest feedback, as the current multi-channel requests (Google reviews, WhatsApp pings, and additional forms) can feel overwhelming and repetitive after a long business trip, detracting slightly from an otherwise excellent stay.

Despite this small point, the overall experience was overwhelmingly positive. Le Meridien Hyderabad truly offers a luxurious and comfortable experience, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city. I look forward to returning!

text.text:
Exceptional Hospitality – Feels Like a Home Away from Home

This is my fourth stay at Trident Hyderabad, and each time I am left amazed by the warmth, professionalism, and genuine care of the entire team. I came here for my family member’s treatment at AGI, and staying at Trident has always made a challenging time so much more comfortable and reassuring.

The staff are truly outstanding – from the warm welcome at check-in to the attentive service throughout the stay, they never fail to make me feel cared for. A very special mention must go to the breakfast team, who went above and beyond by thoughtfully packing food for my parents every single day with so much care and consideration. These small gestures, done with a big heart, reflect the spirit of true hospitality.

The rooms are immaculate, the food is excellent, and the atmosphere is both peaceful and uplifting – exactly what one needs during such visits. What sets Trident apart, however, is the people – their kindness and dedication turn every stay into a memorable experience.

Thank you, Trident Hyderabad, for once again making me feel at home. I look forward to returning, not just for the comfort, but for the incredible team that defines this place. 🌸

editorialSummary.text: Chic rooms & suites in a polished hotel featuring 5 dining options, plus a bar, a spa & 3 pools.

text.text:
The service was impeccable. Staff were proactive, attentive, and made guests feel welcome. The room was spacious, spotless, and comfortable, with the Heavenly Bed providing a perfect night's sleep. The well-appointed bathroom and powerful shower were also a welcome luxury.
The hotel's dining options were a highlight. The extensive breakfast buffet at Seasonal Tastes offered a wide variety of healthy and delicious choices. Fresh juices and smoothies were available, another nod to the hotel's focus on wellness.
The location is ideal for business travelers, situated within the bustling Mindspace IT Park. It's a convenient and peaceful base amidst the city's energy.
Overall, The Westin Hyderabad Mindspace exceeded expectations. The combination of exceptional service, a clean and comfortable environment, and a genuine commitment to guest wellness—including the small, refreshing touches that encourage hydration—made for a truly restorative stay. Future trips to Hyderabad will include a stay at this hotel.

text.text:
Disappointing Experience at Golconda Resorts & Spa – Not Worth the Price

I recently stayed at Golconda Resorts & Spa for 2 days with my family. We had booked 4 rooms and were allotted the Palm Villas, each priced at ₹15,000 per night — shockingly higher than many 5-star hotels in Hyderabad.

Unfortunately, the experience was far from premium. The rooms were in a pathetic condition. There is no proper drainage system; the showers were clogged and only 2 holes were functioning, with bore water full of waste. The bathtubs are directly connected to drainage pipes without filters, making them unusable and unhygienic. The bathrooms were sinking, and the foul smell even entered the bedrooms.

When I raised these concerns the next morning, the front desk casually said all rooms are like this and that they were sold out — clearly showing no interest in customer satisfaction.

Room service was equally poor. You need to call multiple times before anyone even responds. For a place that charges premium prices, the service and quality are severely lacking.

I do not recommend this resort to anyone. It’s overpriced, poorly maintained, and not even close to basic hospitality standards.

Beautiful place with great service, but food needs improvement

Golconda Resort is a lovely getaway — the location is scenic, peaceful, and well-maintained. The ambiance and layout really make it feel like a relaxing retreat.

However, the food was a bit underwhelming, especially considering the pricing. The taste and variety could definitely be better. When we raised our concerns, the staff handled it well — polite, responsive, and eager to help, which we appreciated.

Overall, a great place to relax and enjoy the atmosphere, but there’s room for improvement when it comes to the dining experience.

text.text:
We were a group of four who came to this hotel with the intention of dining, and we had even arranged to meet others there. However, our experience was extremely disappointing and unprofessional from the moment we arrived.

As soon as we walked in, we were treated with hostility. Instead of being welcomed and given a menu, we were told to “stand up and pick your food from over there,” as if we were not guests but an inconvenience. No menu was provided, and the staff were rude and dismissive.

We only ordered tea, but after witnessing the poor treatment and the lack of organization, we decided to leave immediately. The place lacks proper customer service, basic hospitality, and respect for guests.

If you’re a foreigner or even a local, I strongly advise you not to go to this place. The staff are unprofessional, and the environment is far from welcoming. You deserve better service than what this hotel provides.

text.text: Today I am in Hyderabad and flashed back my Horrible experience of this horrible place few years ago. I had forgotten the incident but i just wanted others to know. The place is not worthy of the price they charge. The images are for marketing purposes only. I had booked a garden villa. There was a snake in the Villa which i had booked 2 days. They shifted us in the main Hotel rooms but there too many lizards were on the bed and on the ceiling. I have changed the room again but it was the same. I have spent a sleepess night there. It was my first anniversary plus first Valentine day as a couple so i didn't want to ruin the day. So i wanted to cancel the booking for the next day but they said it's against their policy & can't refund however they promised me that "whenever" i visit there i can complete remaining booking & said that they have all the records in computer. After few months i just called them back that i am coming there, they totally turned away & and started shouting at me that they have never promised such thing. I didn't want to argue and ruin my another visit to the beautiful City. I just let it go. Staff, Place and the Food all are horrible.

editorialSummary.text: Modern extended-stay apartment hotel offering dining & free breakfast, plus a gym & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
I tried this concept of executive apartments for the first time as i was always curious about it. Delightfully it did not disappoint. One of the best swimming pool, bar locations at the rooftop - something that i really enjoy. The staff was excellent and so was the food. The apartment was clean, well managed, comfortable and more than i actually needed (since the staff was kind enough to offer me an upgrade).

Daytime service could definitely use improvement but otherwise i would surely consider this place, especially when i am traveling with family or if i am looking for a longer stay. A bit disappointed with the points system managed by Marriott and slightly on the expensive side so that is something to consider.

It is also well located and having a mall with pubs and shopping stuff in the same building can be helpful. There was no noise disturbance from these additions though.

So overall i had a wonderful experience. Would definitely like to thank Subham (i hope i got the name correct).

I recently attended my weekly BNI meeting at ALTAIR @ Marriott Executive Apartments, and I must say it’s an excellent venue for both professional and social gatherings. The banquet hall is spacious, well-maintained, and ideal for events. What truly stands out is the terrace garden—a beautifully designed space with a stunning panoramic view of the city, adding charm to any celebration or meet-up.

The food was reasonably good, satisfying a variety of tastes, and the service was fantastic, with courteous staff ensuring everything ran smoothly.

I highly recommend ALTAIR to anyone looking to host functions, business meet-ups, or celebrations for around 100 to 200 guests. It strikes the perfect balance between elegance, functionality, and warm hospitality.

text.text:
This hotel truly hit all the right notes for a fantastic stay in the city center. Its prime location was incredibly convenient, placing us within easy reach of all the major attractions. We especially appreciated the excellent public transport connectivity, with the Metro and taxis readily available right outside.

From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how spotlessly clean the entire hotel was. The staff were incredibly friendly and approachable, always ready to assist with a warm smile.

One of the highlights was definitely the breakfast! As vegetarians, we were delighted with the wide array of delicious options, including some wonderful local cuisines. Huge kudos to the chef for preparing everything so incredibly tasty – it was a real treat each morning. We also found the food prices to be very affordable, with their Thali being a particularly great value.

The F&B Manager provided exceptional service, though a bit more attentiveness and approachability from other staff members would further enhance the dining experience.

Finally, a special shout-out to Amandeep, who went above and beyond to ensure our comfort throughout our stay. His attentiveness truly made a difference.

text.text:
I visited Marriott Hyderabad recently for a meeting and found the experience to be excellent overall. The property has a premium ambiance, making it a great choice for both business and social gatherings. The staff was polite, professional, and ensured everything went smoothly during my visit.

While I did not stay overnight, I had the chance to try their food, and that turned out to be the highlight of my visit. The tomato soup was absolutely outstanding – rich, fresh, and full of flavor. Along with it, the jeera rice and basmati rice paired with paneer dishes were simply delicious. The balance of spices and the quality of ingredients really stood out, giving a fine-dining touch to every bite.

The overall service was smooth and well-coordinated, making my meeting experience very comfortable. The atmosphere at the hotel was vibrant yet calm, with a perfect blend of elegance and efficiency. For anyone planning to host meetings, attend events, or simply enjoy a good meal in a classy environment, Marriott Hyderabad is definitely worth considering.

Overall, it was a wonderful visit, and I would highly recommend the place for its hospitality, food, and professional service.

text.text:
Disappointing Experience Despite Smiles

The staff may wear a smile, but their attitude is far from welcoming. It’s as if they’re trained to deliver rudeness politely. Basic amenities like shower gel or other essentials aren’t provided unless you specifically ask — and even then, it feels like a favor.

What’s worse, the manager behaves like he’s doing the guests a favor by simply listening. Instead of resolving concerns, you’re expected to justify your issues to him. A truly frustrating and avoidable experience.

highlightedText.text: "The 32-acre, five-star luxury hotel gives you access to the gilded age."

text.text: Taj Falaknuma Palace in Hyderabad, The 32-acre, five-star luxury hotel gives you vintage feelings back in time to the golden ages, where excess and wealth are both embraced and savoured. Esra, the Turkish Nizam's wife, has magnificently renovated and tenderly repaired the 60 rooms and suites. Each offers breathtaking views of the royal courtyard and Hyderabad, which has been inhabited for 400 years. lavish culinary tour at Adaa, our fine-dining Indian restaurant, and enjoy multi-cuisine specialties at Celeste. Breakfast is served at Celeste & Gol Bungalow, afternoon tea is served on the Jade Terrace, special dinners are served at South East Garden & Jade Terrace, and Gol Bungalow offers a distinctive dining experience. A gem in the clouds, the Taj Falaknuma Palace is perched 2,000 feet above Hyderabad. It was the previous residence of the Nizam, who was once thought to be the richest man on earth and whose palace was constructed in 1894. This charming palace hotel in Hyderabad overlooks the sparkling City of Pearls and oozes romance and grandeur that transport one to the time the Nizam ruled Hyderabad. Our palace butlers serve you like royalty from the time you arrive at Taj Falaknuma Palace in a horse-drawn carriage. Follow in the regal footsteps of the Nizams, European aristocracy, alluring Begums, and illustrious Heads of State by ascending the Grand Staircase. The 32-acre, five-star luxury hotel gives you access to the gilded age. The magnificent Durbar Hall, Jade Room, enormous dining hall with 101 seats and Belgian chandeliers, as well as various gardens and terraces, provide regal grandeur to celebrations and elegance to business gatherings. Feel completely revitalised at our Jiva Spa, which is based on the conventional Indian philosophy of health and has a wellness menu that adheres to the best Ayurvedic culinary practises. The contemporary lifestyle and historic legacy coexist in Hyderabad, a royal city. Our concierge would be happy to book your excursions to popular tourist attractions including the Charminar, Mecca Masjid, Golconda Fort, Chowmahalla Palace, and Ramoji Film City as well as places of interest for art, culture, and shopping.

text.text:
A Perfect Blend of Luxury and Efficiency: My Review of The Leela Hotel
Stepping into The Leela Hotel is an experience in itself – one that immediately conveys a sense of refined elegance and contemporary comfort. Having recently stayed there for a business trip, I can confidently say that this hotel is a top-tier choice for anyone seeking a seamless blend of luxury, convenience, and an environment conducive to productivity.
Unbeatable Location: Without a doubt, one of The Leela's most compelling assets is its prime location. Situated in a vibrant and easily accessible area, it offers incredible convenience for both business and leisure travelers. Whether you need to reach key business districts, major transportation hubs, or simply explore the city's attractions, the hotel's strategic positioning significantly cuts down on travel time and stress. This is a huge plus, especially when you're on a tight schedule.
Impeccably Maintained and Modern: What truly sets The Leela apart is its spotless presentation and remarkably new feel. From the moment you enter the lobby to the well-appointed guest rooms, everything exudes an air of pristine cleanliness and modern design. It's evident that the hotel is either very new or incredibly well-maintained, with contemporary furnishings, state-of-the-art amenities, and a fresh aesthetic that makes for a truly comfortable stay. This attention to detail contributes significantly to a sense of well-being and productivity.
Ideal for Business Meetings and Work: For business travelers, The Leela is an absolute godsend. The hotel's infrastructure and services are perfectly tailored for corporate needs. The meeting facilities are top-notch, offering a range of well-equipped rooms that can accommodate everything from intimate discussions to larger conferences. The seamless technology, professional staff, and comfortable setting ensure that your meetings run smoothly and efficiently. Furthermore, the in-room workspace is thoughtfully designed, providing a quiet and productive environment for catching up on emails, preparing presentations, or simply getting work done. High-speed internet is reliable, and the overall ambiance fosters focus and concentration.
In conclusion, The Leela Hotel is a shining example of a property that understands and caters to the needs of the discerning traveler. Its exceptional location, combined with its pristine condition and excellent business facilities, makes it an outstanding choice for business meetings and work-related stays. Beyond its practical advantages, the hotel also offers the kind of attentive service and luxurious touches that transform a simple business trip into a truly enjoyable experience. I highly recommend The Leela and look forward to my next stay.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Leela Palace, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was impeccable. The staff were warm, courteous, and attentive to every detail, ensuring a seamless and luxurious stay.

The property itself is stunning — an architectural masterpiece that blends traditional elegance with modern comfort. My room was beautifully appointed, with exquisite decor, top-notch amenities, and a view that was simply breathtaking.

Dining at The Leela was a culinary delight, with every meal crafted to perfection. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of fresh, delicious options, and the service was consistently excellent.

What truly stood out was the personalized attention and care provided by the team. It’s rare to find such a genuine commitment to guest satisfaction.

Thank you to everyone at The Leela Palace for making my stay so special. I look forward to returning and highly recommend this palace of hospitality to anyone seeking an extraordinary stay

I’m enjoying an extended stay at The Leela, Hyderabad—and it has been nothing short of extraordinary. The hospitality is gracious and seamless, the décor blends classical charm with modern comfort, and the experience exudes understated luxury at every turn.

The property is adorned with timeless originals by M.F. Husain—each piece a celebration of India’s artistic heritage that simply cannot be missed.

Culinary offerings are exceptional, and service is executed with warmth and finesse.

The Library Bar is a sanctuary for connoisseurs—don’t leave without trying the Negroni, masterfully crafted by Bhuwan, the resident mixologist. Truly exceptional service from Vinod and the entire staff.

A truly distinguished retreat.

Pool and other amenities are also very good but not at the level of some other Hyatt properties in India. 4/5

Food is very good as well, no complaints on variety or taste. Bakery especially the croissants were done very well. Our compliments to the chef. Breakfast spread was very good as well. 4/5

Staff is a hit or miss sometimes. It's a high class hotel so you come across many people who are furthering their careers and focus on doing the job well, hence the rating. A 5 on 5 rating for us is when staff constantly goes out of their way to delight the customers, that spirit felt slightly missing.  However Jagriti, Ram Babu, Megha and Ravinder (bee keeper) seemed to carry that feeling of customer delight and happiness very well, and I hope they are recognized and rewarded for it. I encourage the hotel leaders to spend time with these folks to understand customer delight at the grass root level.

World of Hyatt loyalist recognition is average at best. We're Globalists and an upgrade based on availability seemed to be considered going the extra mile, which in truth is mostly policy. Nothing much was done for our experience as Globalists before sharing our feedback with the staff. Credit where due, things did turn around after we shared our feedback and we could experience the customer delight we were initially looking forward to. 3/5

Overall there's nothing much to be fixed, more fine tuning and polish to optimize customer experience. We would definitely return on our next visit to this amazing city.

text.text:
Everything is good when it’s going well; what happens when it goes wrong?

Check-In Date - 25/07/2024
Check-out Date - 27/07/2024
Room No- 804

I had my first experience with Park Hyatt, and it was all good till 25/07/2024 night. I started feeling sick from the early morning of the 26th and stretched my day, assuming it was travel fatigue. However, the pain in body, throat itch became unbearable by the evening, and I asked if they had an In-house Doctor. The lady replied that there was one and that he would arrive in 30 minutes.

Things start going wrong from here.

1. The doctor arrives in almost 45 minutes (indeed, he can be late due to unavoidable traffic in the city)
2. The doctor does the checkup and prescribes the medicine. Out of professionalism, we asked if any fees were to be paid. The doctor replied that the charges would be tapped under the room bill; however, if we want, we can pay him immediately. We agreed to pay immediately, and his stated fees were 3,000/-. (Being a 5-star hotel; if the customers are taking rooms and paying the uppermost rates of the city, you expect them to take care of you in every sense and not find ways to generate money. Even a 2/3 star hotel can identify a doctor and send them if the customers aren’t keeping well; what matters is how they are taken care of) 3,000/- is an obnoxious amount for a simple check; I remember paying the same amount in Kokilaben hospital for a super-specialist service.

2.1 - The disappointment was when the hotel charged for a doctor's checkup, whereas I feel the five stars I have stayed in last, as the Taj, Leela, ITC has always treated unexpected circumstances as a gesture and not charged.
2.2 Even if the doctor charges, it cannot exceed 500/- for a doctor visit.

3. As the doctor left, he said the hotel would be instructed to buy the medicines. To my surprise, I received medicines after 1 hour. Again, I am unsure whether sending someone is delayed or whether the regular medicine store in Hyderabad is all 10 km away from the hotel.

4. they forgot to bring the prescription as I received the medicine. Again, as I said, please get my prescription; they took another 15 mins to bring it.

5. When I shared my disappointment over the call and asked the on-duty manager to meet me, it took 1 hour for her to call me back/ not meet as I requested and understand my concern. She said that she would put these errors to a higher authority and, as always, suggested that if I need some food/ juice. (The customer isn’t expecting the lack of turnaround time and  obnoxious charge to be compensated by juice/ food)

6. The next day, the 27th, I go for breakfast and hand them over the Apple Watch and charger, requesting to charge. To my surprise, after 1 hour, when I went to receive the watch, it wasn’t charged. Disappointingly, when I said it wasn’t charged, the lady started justifying that she saw that it was kept on charge.

7. At the last checkout and clearing of the room, I paid 979/- for the medicines doctor ordered. (After all the disappointments shared, still course you pay)

Whenever I shared my disappointment, I heard, “Sorry, and I’ll tell the higher authorities. “. In the service industry, when a customer is disappointed, saying sorry isn’t a part of repairing it, but a quantifiable effort has  to be demonstrated to fix it. As we take rooms in the 5star (claimed) hotels, I feel you don’t go for luxury solely but to de-risk your experience and make sure that in the bad times, you will be well taken care of by meeting more than the required turn around times, fast service, over the top gestures and making things delightful.

Sadly, Park Hyatt of Hyderabad is full of Sorries, has the worst turnaround time, and has no lack of empathy and compassion; you are in your place by your own. I am pretty sure this won’t be my repeated destination in future.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre, and I must say that my experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I stepped into the elegant lobby to the time of my departure, every aspect of my stay was marked by luxury, comfort, and top-notch service.

1. Warm Welcome and Efficient Check-In:
Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the hotel staff who exuded professionalism and courtesy. The check-in process was swift, and I was promptly guided to my room, making me feel like a valued guest right from the start.

2. Lavish and Well-Appointed Room:
My room was a haven of modern luxury. The spaciousness, elegant decor, and attention to detail were truly impressive. The comfortable king-sized bed, plush furnishings, and a stunning view of the city skyline ensured a relaxing and enjoyable stay. The room's cleanliness and maintenance were impeccable.

3. Exquisite Dining Experience:
The hotel's dining options were a delightful culinary journey. From the sumptuous buffet breakfast at the restaurant, offering a wide array of international and local dishes, to the fine-dining experience at the on-site specialty restaurant, each meal was a feast for the senses. The attentive staff and the quality of the food truly elevated the dining experience.

4. World-Class Amenities:
Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre boasts a range of world-class amenities. The fitness center was well-equipped and provided a great space for a workout. The outdoor pool and spa facilities were a perfect way to unwind after a busy day. The attention to guest comfort was evident in every aspect of the hotel's design.

5. Exceptional Service:
What truly sets this hotel apart is the exceptional level of service provided by the staff. Every staff member I encountered was courteous, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable. Whether it was the housekeeping staff maintaining the room impeccably or the concierge assisting with travel arrangements, the service was truly remarkable.

6. Convenient Location:
The hotel's location is ideal for both business and leisure travelers. Situated in the heart of Hyderabad, it offers easy access to major attractions and business districts, making it a strategic choice for travelers with various purposes.

In conclusion, my stay at Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre was an experience of pure indulgence. The combination of luxurious accommodations, impeccable service, and top-notch amenities made for an unforgettable stay. If you're seeking a place that seamlessly blends modern comfort with genuine hospitality, this hotel is a must-visit. I can confidently say that I look forward to returning on my next visit to Hyderabad.

_A Luxurious Retreat: The Park Hotel, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad Review_

I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Park Hotel in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I arrived, I was treated to unparalleled hospitality, impeccable service, and a truly luxurious atmosphere.

_Warm Hospitality_

The staff at The Park Hotel went above and beyond to make me feel welcome. The front desk team was efficient and courteous, while the concierge service was knowledgeable and helpful. Every interaction with the staff was a testament to their commitment to excellence.

_Impeccable Service_

The service at The Park Hotel was seamless and attentive. Room service was prompt, and the housekeeping team ensured that my room was spotless and well-maintained throughout my stay. The staff's attention to detail was impressive, and they anticipated my every need.

_Cleanliness and Hygiene_

The Park Hotel's commitment to cleanliness and hygiene is evident in every aspect of the hotel. The rooms, public areas, and dining spaces were all immaculate, with a clear emphasis on maintaining the highest standards of hygiene.

_Tasty Cuisine_

The food at The Park Hotel was a culinary delight. The breakfast spread was extensive, with a wide range of options to suit every taste. The à la carte menu offered an array of delicious dishes, and the room service menu was equally impressive. Every meal was a testament to the chef's skill and creativity.

_Beautiful Ambience_

The Park Hotel's ambience is its crowning glory. The beautifully landscaped gardens, the elegant lobby, and the tastefully decorated rooms all come together to create a luxurious oasis in the heart of the city. The hotel's design is a perfect blend of modernity and tradition, making it a true gem.

_Additional Amenities_

The Park Hotel offers an array of amenities, including a state-of-the-art fitness center, a luxurious spa, and an outdoor pool. The business center is well-equipped, making it an ideal choice for corporate travelers.

_In Conclusion_

The Park Hotel, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a true gem. With its exceptional hospitality, impeccable service, cleanliness, tasty food, and beautiful ambience, it is an ideal choice for both business and leisure travelers. I left with fond memories and a deep appreciation for this luxurious retreat. If you're looking for a truly unforgettable experience, look no further than The Park Hotel.

I recently had the privilege of staying at Avasa, and I must say it was an extraordinary experience that exceeded all expectations. This luxurious haven of hospitality truly embodies the essence of opulence and impeccable service. Allow me to share the remarkable details of my stay, which left me in awe and completely pampered.

From the moment I arrived at Avasa, I was greeted by a grandeur that took my breath away. The hotel's stunning architecture, elegant lobby, and tasteful decor set the stage for a truly memorable stay. Every corner exuded sophistication, creating an ambiance of refined luxury.

The staff at Avasa exemplified hospitality at its finest. From the doormen to the receptionists, the level of professionalism, warmth, and attentiveness was unparalleled. They were genuinely committed to ensuring every aspect of my stay was flawless, accommodating any requests with grace and efficiency. It was evident that the staff took pride in their work and genuinely cared about the satisfaction of their guests.

The rooms at Avasa were nothing short of opulent. Every detail, from the plush bedding to the high-end furnishings, exuded a sense of indulgence and comfort. The attention to detail was impeccable, with thoughtfully curated amenities and luxurious touches that made me feel like royalty. The breathtaking views from my room added an extra layer of magic to the experience.

When it came to dining, Avasa left me in culinary paradise. The range of restaurants and cuisines available was exceptional, each offering a gastronomic journey of exquisite flavors. The Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli is a stylish and contemporary hotel located in the bustling business district of Hyderabad, India. From the moment you enter the lobby, you are struck by the sleek and modern building aesthetics that reflect the hotel's commitment to sustainability.

The exterior of the Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli features a mix of glass and steel, with clean lines and a striking architectural design. The interior is equally impressive, with a spacious and welcoming lobby that features high ceilings, modern furnishings, and beautiful artwork.

The hotel's commitment to sustainability is evident in its carbon footprint, which is significantly lower than other hotels of similar size and luxury. The Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli is LEED certified, which means it meets strict environmental standards for energy efficiency, water conservation, and waste reduction.

The guest rooms at the Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli are well-appointed and comfortable, with plush bedding, modern furnishings, and all the amenities you would expect from a five-star property. The bathrooms are modern and sleek, with high-quality toiletries and luxurious rainfall showers. The rooms offer stunning views of the city and are equipped with state-of-the-art technology, including high-speed internet and flat-screen TVs.

In terms of dining, the Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli offers a range of options to suit all tastes. The hotel's signature restaurant, The Lounge, serves innovative cocktails and light bites in a relaxed and sophisticated setting.

Overall, the Hyatt Hyderabad Gachibowli is an exceptional property that offers luxury and sustainability in equal measure. Its building aesthetics, commitment to reducing its carbon footprint, and detailed physical description make it a must-visit destination for anyone visiting Hyderabad.

Trident Hotel Hyderabad is a luxurious hotel located in the heart of the bustling city of Hyderabad, India. The hotel offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and convenience to its guests. The hotel is located in the Hitec City, which is a hub of business and technology, making it a perfect choice for business travelers. Here is a detailed review of the hotel, including building aesthetics, carbon footprint, and physical description.

The building aesthetics of the Trident Hotel Hyderabad are a perfect blend of contemporary and traditional Indian design. The hotel's exterior is impressive with a combination of glass, steel, and white marble that gives it a modern and sleek look. The interiors are elegant and sophisticated, featuring intricate Indian motifs and textures in warm, earthy colors. The hotel's design showcases a deep respect for the local heritage and culture, and it reflects in every corner of the hotel.

In terms of carbon footprint, the hotel has taken significant steps to reduce its environmental impact. The hotel has implemented a comprehensive recycling program, which includes recycling waste, using recycled materials, and reducing water and energy consumption. The hotel has also installed solar panels to generate electricity, and it has implemented a water conservation program that includes using low-flow faucets and shower-heads.

The physical description of the hotel is impressive, with 323 luxurious rooms and suites that are spacious and elegantly designed. The rooms are equipped with all modern amenities, including air conditioning, LED TV, tea and coffee maker, and mini-bar. The bathrooms are fitted with modern fixtures and have a separate shower and bathtub. The hotel has a beautiful outdoor pool, a fitness center, and a spa that offers a range of rejuvenating treatments.

The hotel has three restaurants, including an all-day dining restaurant that serves international and local cuisine, a specialty Indian restaurant, and a bar that offers a range of cocktails and beverages. The hotel also has a bakery that serves a selection of fresh bread, pastries, and cakes.

The hotel's location is ideal for business travelers as it is close to the Hitec City, a hub of technology and business. The hotel offers a range of meeting and conference facilities that can accommodate up to 800 guests, making it an ideal venue for conferences, seminars, and corporate events.

In conclusion, the Trident Hotel Hyderabad is a luxurious hotel that offers a perfect blend of contemporary design and traditional Indian hospitality. The hotel has taken significant steps towards reducing its environmental impact, and it has implemented a range of sustainable practices. The physical description of the hotel is impressive, with luxurious rooms and suites, beautiful restaurants, and excellent meeting and conference facilities. If you're looking for a luxurious stay in Hyderabad, the Trident Hotel Hyderabad is an excellent choice.

text.text:
The Golkonda Resorts & Spa is a luxurious property located in Hyderabad, India. The resort is situated in a serene location surrounded by lush greenery and offers a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

The building aesthetics of The Golkonda Resorts & Spa are inspired by the historic Golkonda Fort, which is a popular tourist attraction in Hyderabad. The resort's architecture reflects the grandeur and opulence of the fort, with elements like arches, domes, and intricate carvings. The interiors are tastefully decorated with local art and artifacts, creating a perfect blend of modern and traditional aesthetics.

The resort is committed to sustainability and has implemented several eco-friendly practices to reduce its carbon footprint. The property uses solar panels to generate electricity, and the resort's waste is treated and recycled. The resort also has a rainwater harvesting system to conserve water and has implemented energy-efficient lighting to reduce energy consumption.

The physical description of The Golkonda Resorts & Spa is impressive. The resort is spread over 13 acres and has 44 well-appointed rooms and suites. The rooms are spacious and offer breathtaking views of the lush greenery surrounding the resort. Each room is equipped with modern amenities and tasteful interiors, ensuring a comfortable and luxurious stay.

The resort has several dining options, each offering a unique culinary experience. The Golconda Pavilion is the resort's all-day dining restaurant that serves a wide range of local and international cuisine. The poolside restaurant, Barbeque, offers a selection of grilled delicacies. The Lobby Bar is a perfect place to unwind and enjoy signature cocktails and drinks.

The resort's highlight is its spa, which offers a range of rejuvenating therapies and treatments. The spa is designed to provide a tranquil and serene experience and uses natural and organic products to ensure a holistic and sustainable approach.

In conclusion, The Golkonda Resorts & Spa is a luxurious and sustainable property that offers a perfect escape from the city's chaos. The resort's building aesthetics, commitment to sustainability, and tasteful interiors make it a standout property in Hyderabad. If you are looking for a luxurious and sustainable stay in Hyderabad, The Golkonda Resorts & Spa should be on your list.
